  • Method Details

    • logUser

      public boolean logUser​(String username, String password)
      Returns the logging state.

      We use the OAuth2 protocol. If the user is logged in, we store the session in 'api' variable.

      Parameters:
      username - username for login
      password - password for login
      Returns:
      the logging state (true : logged in, false : login failed)
      See Also:
      Boolean

    • getAuthToken

      public String getAuthToken()
      Returns the auth token of the current user logged in.

      We use the GitLab API => /api route Data is fetched using the GitLab4J dependency

      Returns:
      the auth token of the current user logged id
      See Also:
      String

    • getId

      public Integer getId()
      Returns the id of the current user logged in.

      We use the GitLab UserApi => /users route In this case, we have to fetch the data from the API using the REST API and HTTP Request. All data linked to /users route must be fetched from REST API and not with GitLab4J dependency

      Returns:
      the id of the current user logged id
      See Also:
      Integer

    • getMemberGroups

      public List<org.gitlab4j.api.models.Group> getMemberGroups()
      Returns a List of all groups linked to a user.

      This method always returns a List even if the user is not linked to any group. We use the GitLab GroupApi => /groups route

      Returns:
      the List of all groups which the logged user is linked to
      See Also:
      List

    • getMemberProjects

      public List<org.gitlab4j.api.models.Project> getMemberProjects()
      Returns a List of all projects linked to a user.

      This method always returns a List even if the user is not linked to any project. We use the GitLab ProjectApi => /projects route

      Returns:
      the List of all projects which the logged user is linked to
      See Also:
      List
